thread.title: No. 7 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina, 45-24
thread.title_full: No. 7 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina, 45-24

title: No. 7 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina, 45-24
text:
No. 7 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina, 45-24 - WFSB 3 Connecticut Member Center: In the Know No. 7 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina, 45-24 (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman). LSU running back Leonard Fournette (7) stiff arms South Carolina linebacker Skai Moore (10) during the first half of an NCAA college football game in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman). LSU running back Leonard Fournette (7) is pushes out of bounds by South Carolina safety D.J. Smith (24) during the first half of an NCAA college football game in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman). LSU running back Darrel Williams (34) celebrates his touchdown with teammates during the first half of an NCAA college football game against South Carolina in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman). A fan holds a sign in support of South Carolina during the first half of an NCAA college football game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. The game was moved from Columbia, S.C. to Baton Rouge because ... (AP Photo/Jonathan Bachman). South Carolina quarterback Perry Orth (10) throws a pass during the first half of an NCAA college football game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. By BRETT MARTELAP Sports Writer 
BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - Leonard Fournette ran 87 yards for a touchdown, Brandon Harris passed for a career-best 228 yards, and No. 7 LSU defeated South Carolina 45-24 on Saturday in a game moved to Tiger Stadium because of catastrophic flooding in the Gamecocks' home state. 
Fournette finished with a season-low 158 yards on 20 carries in three quarters. Freshman Derrius Guice rushed for 161 yards and a TD, while fellow running back Darrel Williams scored twice as the Tigers (5-0, 3-0 Southeastern Conference) piled up 396 yards rushing. 
Travin Dural had 109 yards receiving for LSU, highlighted by his 62-yard TD. Malachi Dupre also had a touchdown catch. 
With quarterback Lorenzo Nunez nursing a sore shoulder, Perry Orth started for South Carolina (2-4, 0-4). He passed for 200 yards and two TDs against one interception. Rashad Fenton returned a kickoff 96 yards for a touchdown. 
___ 
AP college football website: collegefootball.ap.org
